title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Child Functional Constipation
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Child Functional Constipation provides criteria for diagnosis of child functional constipation.

orgreference.text: Hyams J, Di lorenzo C, Forbes D, et al. Childhood functional gastrointestinal disorders: child/adolescent. Gastroenterology. 2006;130(5):1527-37.

other_refer.text: Tabbers MM, DiLorenzo C, Berger MY, et al. Evaluation and treatment of functional constipation in infants and children: evidence-based recommendations from ESPGHAN and NASPGHAN. J Pediatr Gastroenterol Nutr. 2014;58(2):258-274.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for child functional constipation, patient must have ≥2 of the following (occurring ≥1 time per week for a minimum of 1 month with insufficient criteria for a diagnosis of IBS):

  1. ≤2 defecations in the toilet per week in a child of a developmental age of ≥4 years.
  2. ≥1 episode of fecal incontinence per week.
  3. History of retentive posturing or excessive volitional stool retention.
  4. History of painful or hard bowel movements.
  5. Presence of a large fecal mass in the rectum.
  6. History of large diameter stools that can obstruct the toilet.
